prod_name: Yes4All Interlocking Exercise Foam Mats
title: Average product that could have been better
review: All the mats came in good condition, nothing was damaged. Each piece interlocked with all the others with no issues. I bought these mats to set a small tactile boundary for when I'm doing VR fitness and for the most part, it works for my purposes. What areas could be improved? The first time I used it, I was barefoot and after my workout, my feet were black and a bit slippery so I guess whatever coating is on the mat transfers off. I have these mats on hardwood and the mats have no grip at all so I found the mat slipping a bit around the surface of the floor, which is unfortunate. I will have to apply some type of anti-traction material to the underside (maybe a few rubber nubbins) so that the mat slip doesn't happen (which could be very dangerous for VR).The price for 6 mats is also on the expensive side and knowing how the product functions now for my purposes, I think I would have been better off buying a couple of thicker yoga mats to avoid the slipping and because rolling up a yoga mat is much easier than locking/unlocking all the mat pieces again, since I store it under my couch when not in use.

prod_name: Yes4All Interlocking Exercise Foam Mats
title: Soft & durable
review: I used these to set a sturdy, noncarpeted surface under my guinea pig cage. Works perfect, and is very easy to clean.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 13 December 2023

prod_name: Yes4All Interlocking Exercise Foam Mats
title: Great inexpensive gym flooring
review: These worked great over my bare floors in the basement to make a gym floor.  Might not work for a commercial gym but working great for my personal home gym. Zero issues
date: Reviewed in the United States on 31 December 2023

prod_name: Yes4All Interlocking Exercise Foam Mats
title: Good sound dampening under my stationary bike
review: I just got a stationary bike and needed something on the floor for sound dampening, and to protect my new hardwood floors. These did the jobAll the pieces come with two edge pieces, so if you want to do a 4x4 and a 2x4 (or two 6x2 areas), you'll be short a couple edge pieces.The mat is textured on top, but it still feels a little slippery in socks or barefooted, but since I use it for a stationary bike, this was ok with me. If you want it for working out on, I might find something with more traction.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 15 February 2024

prod_name: Yes4All Interlocking Exercise Foam Mats
title: Garage turned to Yoga gym
review: 120 sq. ft. - 30 tilea boght for mini yoga session at home garage place.This is nice to cover cold/hard suffice under the yoga mat. 30 tiles provided good enough coverage with enough space for 4ppl.I'm puchasing same size again to provide full coverage. Not very thick but good enough.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 26 February 2024

prod_name: Yes4All Interlocking Exercise Foam Mats
title: Easy setup
review: Purchased for a softer workout area in garage. Pieces fit well and it has good padding. Seems like it could have many uses such as a place for toddlers to play if you have hardwood. Definitely eases strain on legs.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 30 January 2024

prod_name: Yes4All Interlocking Exercise Foam Mats
title: True review
review: So I'm writing this because this product had bad reviews. But I think it's competitors.  So you can use this outside works under inclement weather i.e Hurricanes. Stayed in good condition.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 3 February 2024

prod_name: Yes4All Interlocking Exercise Foam Mats
title: They work
review: These are a little thinner than I expected, but they seem to get the job done. We purchased them to put under our rebounder to protect the hardwood floors. So far, they’re working.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 2 February 2024

prod_name: Yes4All Interlocking Exercise Foam Mats
title: Easy to assemble
review: Very easy to assemble
date: Reviewed in the United States on 22 February 2024

prod_name: Yes4All Interlocking Exercise Foam Mats
title: Good quality
review: Good quality for the price
date: Reviewed in the United States on 15 January 2024

prod_name: Yes4All Interlocking Exercise Foam Mats
title: Off-gassing is brutal
review: I set these up right away and figured the extremely strong chemical odor would Go away if I left the windows open. Nope. Next, I heavily mopped each side of these with half vinegar and half water. Nope. Now they're out in my front yard and I'm hoping the sun can off gas them but being that it's winter the sun isn't so bright and the time allotted to a good amount of sunshine is limited. Honestly, if I knew they were going to be this stinky, I would have waited until summer so that I could just leave them outside to cook.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 29 January 2024

prod_name: Yes4All Interlocking Exercise Foam Mats
title: Durable and enough
review: This is durable and plenty of tiles were sent to cover the area that I needed.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 29 December 2023

prod_name: Yes4All Interlocking Exercise Foam Mats
title: Very practical!!!
review: Love the versatile use...
date: Reviewed in the United States on 30 December 2023

prod_name: Yes4All Interlocking Exercise Foam Mats
title: Works ok
review: Trying to find a solution for using a Pvovle mat on carpet. These help the mat to not bunch up so that’s good and solves a big part of what I was struggling with. However, the pieces start spreading apart themselves a bit and the whole mat moves so I have to adjust it/push it back together during and/or after my workout. The mat moving is no fault of the mat - just doesn’t weigh enough to stay immobile on carpet - but I wish the pieces would stay interlocked better.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 15 January 2024

prod_name: Yes4All Interlocking Exercise Foam Mats
title: mats
review: They come apart easily but I quess they will do
date: Reviewed in the United States on 30 October 2023

prod_name: Yes4All Interlocking Exercise Foam Mats
title: Slips and slides
review: More plastic than rubber. Doesn't hold to the floor as I expected. Great for padding but not good for rigorous exercising. Joints don't hold together well either. For the price point it's not worth returning...just a bit disappointing that it doesn't do what they say or what I expected.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 25 January 2024

prod_name: Yes4All Interlocking Exercise Foam Mats
title: Buy a few extra pieces
review: Easy to install
date: Reviewed in the United States on 21 December 2023

prod_name: Yes4All Interlocking Exercise Foam Mats
title: Affordable flooring solution for my home gym!
review: I have a home gym in my basement and since the floor is hardwood, I was looking for a soft solution in the event I ever dropped a dumbbell or something similar. I used these to cover a roughly 8 x 8 area and they worked great, easily locking together and staying in place. Had the whole thing done and my equipment moved in less then 10 minutes. I have a few pieces left over so I'll probably set them up nearby for floor exercises. Good product
date: Reviewed in the United States on 3 July 2023

prod_name: Yes4All Interlocking Exercise Foam Mats
title: Very durable
review: This is a great product!
date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 November 2023

prod_name: Yoga Mat Storage Gym Equipment Dumbbell Stand Dumbbell Rack
title: Pricey but I like it
review: There are likely going to be more affordable options out there, but I must say that this is quite nice! There are two shelves, a big basket and plenty of hooks to hang things if needed. It is very easy to assemble, all the pieces are labeled so it's very straightforward. I think it took me about 10 minutes to put it together from start to finish. I appreciate the fact that they give you the option not to have castors if you don't need them (they included foot pads). I like it!
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 February 2024

prod_name: Daisy Chain for Dip Belt & Weight Belt
title: Sehr gute Qualität!
review: Verwende die Daisy Chain für mein Krafttraining. Diese hat eine super Länge und mit den vielen Laschen auch perfekt für jede Körpergröße anpassbar bzw. auf die Länge sodass das Gewicht super sitzt. Verarbeitung wie gewohnt Top. Deutlich besser wie herkömmliche Ketten die man mit Gewichtsgürteln oft kaufen kann.

prod_name: Daisy Chain for Dip Belt & Weight Belt
title: TOP Produkt!!
review: viel angenehmer als eine normale Dip Kette.  Sehr leicht verstellbar . Und am wichtigsten sehr  praktisch und einfach zum transportieren wenn ich im Gym oder draußen im calisthenics Park nutzen will!! Top

prod_name: Daisy Chain for Dip Belt & Weight Belt
title: krasses Ding
review: Boah, echt ein krasses Ding! Hatte vorher 'ne normale Dip-Kette und die hat mir mein Lieblingsshirt zerfetzt. Mit dieser Daisy Chain ist das zum Glück Geschichte. Super easy zum Verstellen und mega vielseitig einsetzbar. Und das Beste: Es fühlt sich sicher an und ist dabei federleicht. Echt geil für alle, die im Gym oder draußen powern wollen. Mega Teil! 🔥👍

prod_name: Daisy Chain for Dip Belt & Weight Belt
title: Der erste Eindruck ist gut
review: Auf den ersten Blick macht das Teil einen guten Eindruck. Wir sind gespannt, wie es sich im Einsatz verhält.

prod_name: Daisy Chain for Dip Belt & Weight Belt
title: Gehört zu jedem Dip Gürtel dazu!
review: Die Daisy Chain ist meiner Meinung nach um einiges angenehmer als die konventionelle Eisenkette eines Gewichtsgürtels.Man spart sich Gewicht, Platz und vor allem die Lautstärke die durch eine Eisenkette ausgeht.Das Einhaken der Karabiner fällt auch sehr leicht, zudem kann man das Band auch anderweitig nützen.

prod_name: Daisy Chain for Dip Belt & Weight Belt
title: Stabil & Einfach zu nutzen!
review: Wir nutzen das als Alternative zu den Ketten, welche am Dip-Gürtel dran sind, um einfach keine Löcher mehr in die Shirts zu reißen!Fazit: Klappt super und es gibt KEINE Löcher mehr in den Shirts! =)

prod_name: Vinmooog Hand Trainer Finger Trainer Forearm Trainer Fitness
title: Impossibile non acquistarlo per migliorare la forza nella presa!
review: Sono rimasto estremamente soddisfatto dal prodotto! Questo attrezzo da palestra è diventato un elemento essenziale nella mia routine settimanale di allenamento.La funzione di regolazione della resistenza da 5 a 60 kg è estremamente comoda ed intuitiva, permettendomi di adattare l'intensità dell'esercizio in base alle mie esigenze ed al mio livello di forza.La caratteristica più interessante è la funzione di conteggio, che mi permette di monitorare il numero di ripetizioni effettuate durante ogni sessione di allenamento. Questa funzione non solo aggiunge una dimensione interattiva all'allenamento, ma mi motiva anche a superare costantemente i miei limiti.In sintesi, consiglio vivamente l'Hand Grip a chiunque desideri migliorare la forza delle mani e delle dita. È un investimento che si ripaga ampiamente nel tempo, fornendo risultati tangibili e migliorando la presa e la forza generale delle mani. Un prodotto eccezionale che merita indubbiamente 5 stelle!

prod_name: Vinmooog Hand Trainer Finger Trainer Forearm Trainer Fitness

review: Der Fingertrainer hat meine Erwartungen bei weitem übertroffen! Die kompakte Größe und das einfache Design machen ihn äußerst benutzerfreundlich. Das Training mit diesem Gerät hat meine Fingerkraft und Geschicklichkeit signifikant verbessert.Was mir besonders gefällt, ist die individuelle Einstellbarkeit der Widerstandsstufen. Ob Sie Anfänger sind oder bereits über starke Finger verfügen, dieser Trainer bietet die Flexibilität, sich Ihren Bedürfnissen anzupassen. Die Materialqualität ist ausgezeichnet, und die Konstruktion fühlt sich langlebig an.Ich benutze den Fingertrainer regelmäßig, sei es beim Arbeiten am Computer oder in meiner Freizeit, und die Ergebnisse sind deutlich spürbar. Ich kann diesen Fingertrainer ohne Vorbehalte empfehlen, er ist ein ausgezeichnetes Werkzeug zur Verbesserung der Fingerkraft und Geschicklichkeit.

title: Very good
review: I am very happy with the product

prod_name: CDCASA Adjustable Dumbbells, 44 or 66 Lbs Weight Set
title: Far Cheaper than a curl bar
review: Overall this is a good product id recommend, I got it for 160 but I dont think I'd pay more than that.The Good- it is compact and looks very clean, the design is appealing and the foam cushion on the bar is just thick enough to not be a hindrance. Ive never had adjustable dumbbells before so being able to drop weight was nice, plus I took the plates on a nice ruck and they fit in my backpack well. It is also available in a time where workout equipment is overpriced and scarce.The Minor Bad Flaws-There is black paint on the side of the plates and after a month or so ive rubbed some spots clean with my outer knuckles.The dumbbell handles do not appear to be locked in place, but appear that they can be twisted on their individual metal bars. This hasn't been a problem yet, but if you took this thing apart every day I could definitely see the wear causing it to spin more out of place.The Big bad-This thing is a pain to put together and take apart, I dont use the dumbbell functions anymore as I have my own. Attaching the first dumbell to the center bar is easy, attaching the second is a much harder task. I'm pretty strong, screwing the second in requires you to hold it perfectly level and screw it in for about 30 seconds before it catches. You wouldn't think this would be that bad but there's no way to do this that isn't incredibly awkward, and twisting a 33 pound dumbell around while also holding it up one handed puts alot of strain on your wrist. I essentially leave the inside plates loaded, and load and unload the outside plates as needed. I think this is more a design flaw than anything and could be fixed by someone smarter than I.Overall its a good, clean looking product, if you're looking for 70lb barbell to do curls and bench with since the gyms are closed this is a good fit for you. You won't find a cheaper option thats actually of good build quality, at least I couldn't.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 28 May 2021

prod_name: CDCASA Adjustable Dumbbells, 44 or 66 Lbs Weight Set
title: very flexible and easy to use
review:
The media could not be loaded.
                
            
                
            
        
    
    
🎥 review with audio commentary.Overall Take on the weight Set: The attached video shows the barbell to dumbbell conerversion. The rubber material used is nice and flexible for the grip. You are able to secure the weights in place by using bolts included. These are a great value.  It is great because it is so flexible.  You can quickly change between barbell and dumbbells. Rubber coating on weights is a nice touch. I recommend this to anyone who is trying to build their home gym in an economically efficient way as this product is features two essential weight lifting tools (barbell and dumbbell).Why it’s useful for MY at home gym:I already have a cable set this is a bit old but made its appearance again with everything that this year has brought (need to stay away from public gyms). Cable machines are so versatile and an amazing but extremely pricy addition to an at home gym - we were lucky and had an old one already. As grateful as I am for a cable machine it’s really important to use free weights because it forces you to use your core to stabilize the weight. I use barbell mode mostly for my leg days to do good mornings and RDLS and of course hip trusts. I like to use the dumbbell mode for arm days. Moves I used dumbbell mode for include bicep curls, flies, and for bench presses.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 11 November 2020

title: Fine product and helpful seller
review: I wasn’t happy when I got this product initially because there were clearly some manufacturing defects with the plates. In particular, one of the plate had a significant bump inside the ring, making it impossible to insert the bar.I contacted with the seller and he/she apologized and offered me a replacement. I received the replacement plate one week later and that one didn’t have any defect.I have been using this set for a few months. So far so good. In the end, I’m happy with the purchase. The price is reasonable, especially comparing to other insane ones on Amazon. I needed this because I can’t go to the gym in the middle of the pandemic.

prod_name: CDCASA Adjustable Dumbbells, 44 or 66 Lbs Weight Set

The ONLY downside to these is the fact that they are labeled in KGs and not LBs - having to calculate /convert with google was a small inconvenience. But everything else about these is great. Lastly, having the ability to transform into a bar is another great aspect of this product. Would definitely recommend!

date: Reviewed in the United States on 26 February 2024

prod_name: CDCASA Adjustable Dumbbells, 44 or 66 Lbs Weight Set
title: VOC laden physical fitness equipment from a Chinese company that is very hard to source
review: First time opening the box, I was hit in the face with a dense cloud of volatile organic carbons, and this would not go away. I could not return them without paying for shipping, which was $200, so I sat there and stewed over my purchase, cursing the heavens that a healthy workout indoors would require the inhalation of chemicals that would preserve a deceased elephant for thousands of years.I soaked all the weights in containers of baking soda, that worked a little, but what really had to happen was allow the sun’s UV plus several days of off-gassing to happen, but this was not the worst of it. The silly foam and plastic padded bars that are provided were the worst offenders of the toxic smells. These, I had no choice but to tightly seal with several passes of medical and/or electrical tape to conceal the vapors to a level that was not very easily detected by the nose (I’m sure a gas chromatograph would beg to differ).These weights and bars are just toxic and silly, stay away, and whatever you do, don’t ever think you’ll find anybody behind this product that is easily contacted or is accountable on a level of permissible human toxins in final products with good quality control, nope, get ready to feel like a lab rat.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 February 2024

prod_name: CDCASA Adjustable Dumbbells, 44 or 66 Lbs Weight Set

prod_name: CDCASA Adjustable Dumbbells, 44 or 66 Lbs Weight Set
title: Not the most convenient but they work
review: This is not the most convenient setup. When changing the weight you have to unscrew the whole thing. Still, seeing as I might never view my gym in the same way post-Covid, it’s a way to vary the weight without buying separate dumbbells. My daughter keeps telling me I should buy the more expensive set we bought her, but it’s a lot of money for a set that goes up to 300 lbs, when 30 is about my limit. To avoid long breaks resetting the weights, you can break up your days, i.e., doing all the exercises you do with a lighter weight one day and all those with a heavier weight the next. Can do the same with dumbbell/barbell. I also change off with bands, tubes and loops to vary it a bit. But, let’s face it, short of spending a fortune on fully equipped at-home gym, nothing will ever be quite the same.

title: Functional but takes a long time to put together and disassemble
review: I've had these since November, so I waited until March to do a review on the product.  For me, I do body pump.  I am always changing my weights for different muscle groups within a workout.  This bar works great, but you have to be very strategic in how you set it up for your warmup (lighter weights on interior) and the interchangeable weights on the exterior.  The twisties that hold the weights in place take a long time to untwist and retwist, I ended up buying $2 clamps on Amazon to help quickly remove weights and re-stack my bar between tracks as I believe a workout can be ineffective if you take forever to fidget with your weights.  I find that I use them frequently, however, so it works fine!
date: Reviewed in the United States on 15 March 2021

prod_name: CDCASA Adjustable Dumbbells, 44 or 66 Lbs Weight Set
title: Item as described
review: The item was shipped on time.  I already used it once.  The dumbbells are a little bulkier then what I am used to in gym.  If you are using just one set of weights then the rod sticks out and you need to be careful so you don't injure yourself on the face if you are trying to lift it overhead.  It can take up to 5 minutes if you need to change weights during a routine if you want to vary the resistance.  Otherwise they will work fine.  It will help if we have option to buy parts of it separately. e.g. extra rods or extra weights instead of buying a whole set again.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 25 March 2021

prod_name: CDCASA Adjustable Dumbbells, 44 or 66 Lbs Weight Set
title: Nice set but came slightly flawed…
review: I got the dumbbell set and it was nice and all until I went to screw the yellow clamp onto one of the dumbbell rods and it wouldn’t screw on. Luckily I was able to buy another version of those clamps on Amazon that worked great but if I couldn’t find a pair of clamps then I wouldn’t have been able to use the second dumbbell. Emailed company about the defect but gotten no response so one less star rating because of the defect but was able to resolve the next day and use them both.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 26 June 2021

prod_name: CDCASA Adjustable Dumbbells, 44 or 66 Lbs Weight Set
title: Handy with the og box as nice storage
review: So I got these as they are a decent enough deal with a coupon and someone had gifted me an AMazon gift card and I still could not go to the gym so I said what the heck. I am pretty happy with them, although they could have some heavier weights with the original seller to go further than 66 lbs (so limited expandability) but as far as market price and what it does in its weight range, fantastic. The original box and the styrofoam make for great storage even if not necessarily intended and will help with saving room.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 May 2021

prod_name: CDCASA Adjustable Dumbbells, 44 or 66 Lbs Weight Set
title: Twist locks
review: After having it a few months the twist locks come off easier and which each set I have to retighten them. Gets very annoying.

prod_name: CDCASA Adjustable Dumbbells, 44 or 66 Lbs Weight Set
title: Complement my workout 🏋️‍♂️
review: When the pandemic started I stopped going to the gym and started running outdoors. I needed something else to balance my cardio and when I saw these weights I knew they where perfect for small spaces. The  package came very well wrapped and it was easy to take the weights out and assembled them. They feel pretty soft to the touch, can’t wait to start using them.I only had a hiccup with the FedEx deliverer, who left the package where all the mailboxes are ( I live in a big complex) instead of in front of my townhouse. I contacted the seller and immediately they replied, they were very apologetic and promised to follow up after the weekend.  My husband found the package outside next to all the 100 mailboxes and brought it home.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 31 January 2021

prod_name: CDCASA Adjustable Dumbbells, 44 or 66 Lbs Weight Set
title: Good product but...
review: I really do like these weights and I love the versatility of them. The only downside for me is I'm a dumb American who doesn't understand the metric system and these are in KG. At some point I'll be adding a vinyl decal saying what the weight is in pounds.ALSO and most importantly for SAFETY: Sometimes the yellow nuts come loose. ALWAYS check and tighten them before you start working so you don't hurt yourself.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 22 October 2021

prod_name: CDCASA Adjustable Dumbbells, 44 or 66 Lbs Weight Set
title: Good product but the plastic collars aren’t very durable.
review: Seems like a good product with one exception. The collars that hold the plates to the bars are plastic not metal. They do not seem to be very durable. There metal ones available for about $12.00 a pair. They are stronger and easier to use. This addition would make the product much better to use/assemble and longer lasting.

My only complaint is that the screw on “clip” to keep the weights in place comes lose very often and you have to constantly tighten it which is very annoying when your in the missing of a high intensity workout.Other than that one thing these weights are very sturdy and durable.

prod_name: Resistance Bands Widerstandsbänder
title: Comprehensive and Versatile Resistance Bands Kit for Total Body Fitness
review: I recently purchased the Resistance Bands Weight Building Kit, and I am thrilled with the diverse range of exercises it has added to my home workout routine. This comprehensive kit, featuring 12 elastic bands with a total resistance of 150 lbs, is a game-changer for anyone looking to elevate their fitness regimen.The variety of resistance levels in this kit is impressive, providing options for users of all fitness levels. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced fitness enthusiast, these bands offer a customizable workout experience. The color-coded bands make it easy to identify the resistance level at a glance, facilitating a smooth transition between exercises.The inclusion of anklets and a door grip in the kit adds a new dimension to my workouts. The ankle straps are comfortable and secure, allowing for targeted lower body exercises, while the door grip expands the range of upper body workouts. This versatility makes the kit suitable for a wide range of activities, including yoga, calisthenics, gym workouts, CrossFit, TRX, Pilates, and more.The build quality of the bands is excellent, and they feel sturdy during use. The durable latex material ensures longevity, and the bands maintain consistent tension even with regular use. The set is compact and portable, making it easy to take my workout on the go or store it conveniently at home.One notable feature is the ease of incorporating these bands into my existing exercise routine. The kit comes with a helpful guide showcasing various exercises, making it accessible for users of all fitness levels to create a well-rounded workout plan.In summary, the Resistance Bands Weight Building Kit offers a fantastic value for its versatility, durability, and user-friendly design. Whether you're aiming to build muscle, improve flexibility, or add variety to your workouts, this kit delivers on all fronts. I highly recommend it to anyone seeking a convenient and effective home gym solution.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 February 2024

title: durable, comfortable
review: This belt is AWESOME!! It's the first belt I've ever tried that I've felt secure in. I was looking for a weight belt for a while, spending a long time in Amazon looking at all of them after about 3 weeks and numerous searches, I finally found the one! The DMoose belt is awesome looking and comfortable to wear.I got this specifically as a solution for additional support doing my squats and deadlift exercises.I am so pleased with this belt! For not knowing anything about this product before ordering, I am very satisfied.I ordered the XL, it's a jut a tiny bit lose, but this is my fault for using the chart.I'm starting to love Dmoose's products.they are affordable and very well built.

prod_name: DMoose Weight Lifting Belt - Lifting Belt with Self-Lock System
title: Excellent Belt
review: Excellent product!  I have two compressed lumbar discs and need lumbar support when I am working out using weights. I have been using the belt now for approximately one month and I have absolutely no complains. Because of the excellent support I can now use heavier wights in my workout routines.  As noted in another review, measure your waist size at the level of your naval. DO NOT use your pant size.  Based on my measurement I needed a medium and its fits perfectly. Had I used my pant size I would have ordered a large.

prod_name: DMoose Weight Lifting Belt - Lifting Belt with Self-Lock System

prod_name: DMoose Weight Lifting Belt - Lifting Belt with Self-Lock System
title: the build quality
review: OMG!!! I have been looking everywhere for something like this. I am so happy I found it. I can't imagine a better belt for a lifter. A very good combination of support and comfort. Compared to other weight belts I have used the quality of DMoose Belt is 10 times better. This belt provides a certain feel and support that other harsh belts tend to fail at providing. The material appears very well made and strong without being stiff, therefore it conforms to your body perfectly without any awkward openings or gaps. Overall I am super pleased with this product! Highly recommend!

And yes, I know you're not supposed to wear these for a peolonged time but this is the only way i can properly do my job. I have lost weight since purchasing this belt and will be ordering a size smaller but i will stick to this brand for years to come. Another reason i like this belt or brace, it doesnt matter, is that after daily use since purchasing which is over 4 months, the velcro is still strong and isnt showing signs of wear. Great product! It worked well, but I lost weight and needed a smaller size. I've had chronic back issues in the past so I thought this would be a good choice since it was much wider and appears to support the lower back better. It doesn't. The wider belt supports more OF the lower back, but it does so by spreading out the same amount of pressure as a 4 inch belt, over a larger area. Physics is like that. For me the reduction in pressure does not work and my back has been bothering me since I started using it.

prod_name: Yes4All Barbell Foam Bar Pad - Barbell Squat Pad
title: Works great for heavy barbel squats, but moves around too much.
review: I use this for heavy barbel back squats (my working set is about 5 reps of 400 pounds). I was getting tired of bruised shoulders and cysts from squatting without any cushioning, so I found this. It does fit onto my standard sized 45 pound olympic barbell, but the main problem is that it won't stay put. It doesn't move from side to side exactly, but when I am squatting with it, it will slide and rotate on the barbell and sometimes rotate to where the opening of the squad pad meets my shoulder, causing the pad to slide out of the barbel. This actually can create a bit of a dangerous situation when in the middle of a heavy squat. I've managed to avoid this issue with a bit of practice and making sure to position the pad at a certain angle before each set to where it won't rotate into the opening, but I feel like there needs to be a better way to secure this to the barbell.This does work fairly well with some practice. It provides adequate cushioning - actually probably too much cushioning for heavy barbell squats to where the thickness of the pad causes me to have to adjust my form a bit. But it still works better than the towel method I was using before, and it's a much higher quality product that most other pads I've tried which just fall apart. I've found this product to be extremely durable.If this had slightly thinner cushioning and fit more securely onto the barbell, this would definitely be a 5/5.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 28 November 2018

It’s not that super-soft material, it’s polyester, but it’s comfortable enough.FitWhen you first hold them up, they look small. But when you get them on, they stretch (10% spandex I believe).If you are a size 10-12 in women’s pants, a Large will fit.I think a size 8 could also take Large unless you like them snug, then get a M.If you are a thick-waisted 12, or a 14 in women’s pants, I would get XL.

prod_name: Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar for Doorway
title: A Great Pull Up Bar For A Great Price
review: Needed something I can work out with when I don’t feel like going to the gym. It is simple but you can do so many exercise with it.I also anchored my TRX to this bar, and it worked out perfectly. Feels stable. I would recommend it.

prod_name: Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar for Doorway
title: Must have, simple and easy to use
review: This pull up bar was exactly what I wanted at a great price. Assembly is a breeze requiring just 4 bolts and nuts and a wrench is included. Build quality, parts quality, overall fit and finish, versatility, ease of installation and removal, usability and sturdiness of this pull up bar are all excellent. Stays right where it's supposed to. The included resistance bands, handles and resistance band door anchor were a very useful bonus too. There's absolutely nothing to complain about. I'm very happy and satisfied with this purchase.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 31 January 2024

prod_name: Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar for Doorway
title: nice exercise
review: I recently purchased the Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar for Doorway, and it has been a great addition to my home gym setup. This pull-up bar is designed to provide a versatile and effective upper body workout, and it lives up to its promises.The construction of this pull-up bar is impressive. It is made from thickened steel, which gives it excellent stability and durability. With a maximum weight limit of 440 lbs, it can accommodate a wide range of users, providing a safe and secure platform for various upper body exercises.Installation of the bar is straightforward. It is designed to fit most standard doorways, and the adjustable length feature ensures a snug and secure fit without the need for permanent modifications to the door frame. It’s also easy to remove and store when not in use, making it a portable and space-saving fitness solution.One of the standout features of this pull-up bar is its multi-grip design. It offers various grip positions, including wide, narrow, and neutral grips, allowing for a wide range of exercises to target different muscle groups. This versatility adds to the effectiveness of the workouts and keeps them challenging and engaging.Using the Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar has been a great experience. The bar provides a solid and comfortable grip, allowing me to perform pull-ups, chin-ups, and other exercises with confidence. The stability of the bar gives me the peace of mind to focus on my form and maximize the benefits of each workout.One thing to note is that depending on the doorway and the molding around it, there might be slight variations in the fit and stability of the bar. It’s essential to ensure a proper and secure installation to minimize any potential movement during exercises.Overall, the Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar for Doorway is a reliable and effective fitness tool for upper body workouts. Its sturdy construction, adjustable fit, and multi-grip design make it a versatile choice for individuals looking to strengthen their upper body muscles conveniently at home. Whether you’re a beginner or a seasoned fitness enthusiast, this pull-up bar is a worthy investment for achieving your fitness goals.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 June 2023

prod_name: Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar for Doorway
title: Easy set up
review: I've been using this pull-up bar for months. Overall, it's pretty nice. The rubber pads are nice as they prevent the pull-up bar from leaving any marks on my doorway. It's great for chin-ups and neutral pull-ups, but it's kind of awkward for regular pull-ups because of the placement of the foam grips. The accessories that come with it are useless though. Just do negative pull-ups if you can't do any regular ones.

prod_name: Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar for Doorway
title: Very happy with it!
review: Easy set up.  Feels sturdy.But I'm a little afraid to use it.  More from I'm unsure whether my door frame can support this than that the equipment feels flimsy (which it doesn't).
date: Reviewed in the United States on 15 January 2024

prod_name: Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar for Doorway

prod_name: Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar for Doorway
title: Stable
review: The Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar for Doorway has truly upped my home workout game! The thickened steel construction gives it a robust feel, and the impressive 440 lbs weight limit instills confidence for a sturdy and secure workout.What I love most is the multi-grip design, providing a variety of hand positions for a versatile upper body workout. The fact that it easily fits in a doorway makes it a convenient addition to my home gym setup. No need for complicated installations or permanent fixtures – it's the epitome of portable fitness.The durability and strength of this pull-up bar are undeniable. It's become a staple for my daily routine, offering a challenging yet rewarding upper body workout. The Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar is a fantastic investment for those looking to enhance their home gym with a reliable, versatile, and portable fitness solution. Highly recommended for fitness enthusiasts of all levels!

Daughter wanted something easy and portable for chin ups.The included silicon pads to cushion the bar on the door frame is nice; can still be used without adhesive so can be moved around.  Nice padding to help distribute force on door jam to prevent marks along with the cushion on the bar.

prod_name: Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar for Doorway
title: NA
review: As women, it’s hard for us to do pull ups. But if you get this you can do them any time any day! Practice until you get 10-20!!
date: Reviewed in the United States on 22 February 2024

prod_name: Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar for Doorway
title: Great product for the price - good customer service
review: I am not handy (at all) and was able to assemble to product in less than 10 minutes. It seems very sturdy as a whole and the soft grips are quite comfortable. Fits well in a regular doorframe and works as advertised. It comes on/off the door in seconds, so we tend to remove it every evening (just in case it falls off - although it hasn't yet).My husband is 6ft tall and so he needs to curl his knees to use it (we have regular 8 or 9 ft ceilings - so that dictates how high off the ground our doorframe is). He doesn't enjoy it as much, but I get a lot of use out of it.I had an issue with the initial package I received - the were that were included were too short. I emailed the seller and they rectified the issue very quickly.Overall satisfied with the purchase and would buy again.

prod_name: Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar for Doorway
title: Good purchase
review: The product is quality, sturdy, easy to put together, and worth every penny. I recommend having your own wrench to assemble as the included one is extremely cheap but I love everything else about this!
date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 January 2024

prod_name: Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar for Doorway
title: will pull your door trim off
review: can't do a real pull up with it or you'll rip your door trim off. You should not be putting weight on the horizontal bar, as that needs to be the fulcrum. By holding on to the horizontal bar, you're just pulling the whole system practically straight down so the top retaining bar just gets pulled down and rips off the top door trim. You can only put weight on the ends of the 2 curved posts sticking out in the "neutral pull up" in their image. Another horizontal bar would need to be added to the system to do a proper pull up and have it lever into the door frame properly.

prod_name: Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar for Doorway
title: A little shady
review: It supports my weight, but the little hook that holds it in the doorway seems to look a little unstable so I would suggest you add some screws on your doorframe then put the hook on, just to be safe. It felt a little shaky while I was doing chin ups but so far it's pretty dang good. Totally worth your buck, go for it.

prod_name: Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar for Doorway
title: Couldn't use it
review: Screws, bolts didn't lock into place. Remained unsteady and unsturdy. Not built for all doors. Handles maximum length did not fit door ways of all but my bathroom door. Even then it was barely making it. Was unsturdy when using. Felt wobbly. Couldn't take apart. Screws wouldn't come out. It would be good if not for the unsturdiness and it didn't fir the door frames. Came with extra accessories which was a huge plus
date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 December 2023

prod_name: Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar for Doorway
title: Good value for money despite the 4 stars
review: I didn’t want to pay much for a door frame pull up bar, so the price of this item was really good. When I received it, it was easy to assemble, took me maybe 5 - 10 minutes.The bar itself once up does feel a bit flimsy but it’s worked so far and I’ve had it for a while now, like a few months and it’s holding up great still. Keep in mind I’m 65kg and my husband is about 75kg - so we aren’t super heavy, not sure how much weight it can handle but I’m sure the strength of the doorframe will also have a part to play.I also enjoy using all the extra bits that came with it, feels a bit cheap but when you’re on a budget this is great!

prod_name: Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar for Doorway
title: Great value
review: Works perfect and easy to install 🙂
date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 February 2024

prod_name: Ally Peaks Pull Up Bar for Doorway
title: Overall good product; just a few small complaints
review: I like this bar, and it's held up well to a few months of use. The only things I'd say could be improved are that the rubber sleeves at the end which sit on the silicon pads have a tendency to "walk" down the bar during use if you use it on a door frame with any kind of taper or curve. I have to adjust them every time I use it. The foam grips have also started to deform a bit, which I'm not too surprised by. I might have to replace them at some point if they start tearing. The caps at the end of the bar also sometimes come out of their housing, but that doesn't really affect the structural integrity. Just a small quality thing I'd like to see improved.I would also like to mention though that I reached out to the manufacturer to ask if they sold extra silicon pads so I could use this bar in multiple locations without damage, and they sent me a whole pack of extras for free. So I really appreciate that.

Viele Videos als Inspiration und Anleitung im Mitgliederbereich der eigenen Webseite und auch auf Instagram. Danke, Arena Strength! <3I looove my newest and dearest training equipment! title: NA

The exercise guide covers all routines for each gluteal muscles and legs and are well descriptive, explaining each detail in performing exercises. The case is handy for traveling or keeping the bands in one place. One will not be disappointed with these bands.

It even explains how to do each exercise in detail so you can't go wrong.  Both workout options are great and you are sore after every workout regardless if you use body weight or weights. When I first started using them I started seeing results within 2 weeks.I have had my bands now for almost two years and holy wow are these things durable! I have used bands in the past and within a year I had to replace. date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2022

prod_name: Arena Strength Booty Fabric Bands
title: So much better than thin plastic bands
review: I've been using the traditional thin rubber workout bands for two years. I would often find youtube videos I liked working out to, but would give up on a consistent program due to how annoying the thin bands were. Especially when doing leg/glute workouts, they would roll up on me and become slightly painful to pull against. I wouldn't waste the time to readjust them for every move, so I'd just endure the discomfort. I just received these thick Arena bands and they are worlds better. They are super comfortable, even against my bare legs. I made it through an entire glute workout without them shifting or rolling up. I don't think it's even possible for these to roll up. They have a slightly grippy rubberized interior so that they stay in place. I specifically bought the wider straps for leg workouts. I noticed right away that they are harder to stretch than my former flimsy plastic bands. I used to do this particular workout with the heaviest weight band of my old set and it wasn't much resistance. I naturally thought I'd go straight for the heavy band in the Arena set... it is waay stronger than my old band. I used the lightest band in the Arena set and got a better workout than I was with the heaviest strength band in my old set. I don't think this means that you need to be "advanced" to buy the Arena set. I think it just means my old set was almost useless... it provided very little resistance. I was worried about paying $40+ for bands, thinking it may not be worth it, but I am instantly glad I did. These make my workout quicker (no adjusting needed) and more effective. They are comfortable (working out is already uncomfortable enough without adding in bad equipment, why not make it more comfortable where you can), and I can tell by the construction they will last. Very pleased. Sooo worth it. If you workout regularly you should definitely upgrade to these. And if you don't workout regularly, it might help to have better working, more comfortable equipment. It's definitely motivating to know I'll have a successful workout before I begin.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 8 July 2020

prod_name: Arena Strength Booty Fabric Bands
title: Highly recommended!
review: Highly recommended!Been using these for a couple weeks now and they are very durable and comfortable - they do not slip (which is great!) and I love that they are machine washable.The little training booklet you get with them is an added extra; being quite new to this type of workout out, it is a huge help.Also happy that the band's come with a warranty - bit of peace of mind.These are not like some other "cheapy" bands on Amazon. Worth every penny.

prod_name: Arena Strength Booty Fabric Bands
title: Very satisfied
review: I read a lot of reviews before purchasing these online, and I came across some bad reviews about the quality. I emailed the store to ask them what was up, and they responded very quickly explaining that they indeed had problems with their manufacturer, that it was really unfortunate for them, and ensured me that it has all been sorted. I decided to trust them and went for it, and have been very satisfied with the quality. I love that the bands are all the same size while increasing the tension, and the fabric aspect makes them really comfortable and doesn't tug on my clothes, skin, or little hairs. The grey band (lightest weight) probably gets the most use for me (and the widest stretch range since it's the lightest), and I have definitely noticed a bit of loosening over the months (hence the 4 stars). The others, however, are holding up great. I honestly use the workout guide that's included in the package every single time I use the bands, as a reference or to structure my workout for the day. It's really useful and even has accompanying youtube videos to better show the exercises. The first time I used them I was traveling, and the suggested routines in the book are seriously killer- I was actually sore the next day, which was really unexpected because I'm usually lifting heavy weights for my booty workouts when I'm not traveling. They include a week's worth of workouts for situations where you have access to a gym AND situations where you don't. All around very satisfied!
date: Reviewed in the United States on 29 August 2019

These don't feel like they're gonna snap anytime soon, sweat proof and don't roll!!! I'm currently using the lightest band to build up but I'm using it more for getting fit. Great addition to workouts especially if you're a beginner like me and have no clue what you're doing. You get a leaflet with exercise suggestions along with a workout plan and online video tutorials.

title: Mostly Good
review: The bands themselves seem good (I just got them and have used them twice, so I'm not sure about the long-term durability), but what upset me out of the gate was when I opened my Amazon bag containing the plastic case that the bands come in and attempted to unzip it, the zipper pull fell off immediately. Wow, why the low quality case?  Either send the bands without a case or (preferably) upgrade the zipper so that the case can be used. First impression was horrible.....
date: Reviewed in the United States on 12 June 2023

prod_name: Arena Strength Booty Fabric Bands
title: Booty bands
review: I found using the bands with exercises are the only way to go. I did the Arena Strength for a few weeks, started with pink medium bands, loved the exercises & found them effective. I am now using the grey light band for full range of motion. I am growing stronger. I find the pink medium  band has a little give after using it for awhile. I am looking for lower abdominal exercises with bands - seen the few exercises online on the Arena Strength website, looking for more specifically for lower abs, and targeting lower back fat & muscle tone. I have used other exercises from other sites, and circling back see the value in these Arena Strength exercises for lower body. I really like Anna Donauer featured on the workout guide, and would like to see her demonstrate more of the exercises on the website. This has been a great investment in myself, growing strength, and these bands. Highly recommend!
date: Reviewed in the United States on 11 March 2023

review: Quality seems good so far. They came with some nasty chemical smell to them, but I assume that'll fade out over time. I like the cloth vs other brands rubber.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 25 July 2023

prod_name: Arena Strength Booty Fabric Bands
title: Love the Bands, Website Not So Much
review: Love these bands. No bulky equipment. They will help with my upper leg strength. Worth every penny.Website is only about buying stuff. Nothing more. It’s very, very difficult to find the free stuff they brag about in their booklet that comes with the bands.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 June 2023

prod_name: Arena Strength Booty Fabric Bands
title: FANTASTIC CUSTOMER SERVICE!!
review: I actually have two other brands of fabric type bands. One is a set of three, but #2 and #3 of the set are just smaller in diameter, NOT stronger.. I’m tall and a narrower band doesn’t even make the exercise possible to do in correct form. The other band I have I like, but it’s REALLY strong. I bought this set so I could have 3 strengths of bands all the SAME diameter. That’s FANTASTIC!! I use the weakest for some exercises like, donkey kicks, I’ve never been able to have my thigh horizontal to the floor, and foot flat horizontal to the ceiling during the repetitions. I use the middle band for the walking exercises. I haven’t made it to the strongest band yet.  The form used during booty workouts? Is EVERYTHING. No wonder I couldn’t feel the other workouts.Secondly, the book is FANTASTIC. I LOVE IT!! It’s thick, plastic coated pages. It gives you lists of exercises to do on several different days, and includes workouts to do at a gym with the bands. The excellent photographs are extremely high quality, you can see the EXACT form needed. I turn on my music, open my booklet, and do my exercises!! Sometimes exercise videos are annoying because they move too fast, you can’t tell if your form is correct, (which is EVERYTHING), or I need to do variations. I like doing the workouts by looking at a list, it reminds me of workouts at a gym. Although, I have done the Arena Strength 10 minute video and found it excellent, the model is positioned, so you can see how to do each exercise correctly, and the entire time, you also see her reflection in the mirror so you can tell exactly what she’s doing!!Now regarding customer service. I had a odd problem with my order. I found the email address for Arena Strength customer service on the booklet and emailed them with photos. Within a few hours? I had a personal email reply from one of the actual owners of the company!! (Two women own this company!) She was incredible, and fixed my issue IMMEDIATELY. It already was a fantastic program and product anyhow, this just made me a loyal customer. Thank you Arena Strength!! 💪🏼🍑
date: Reviewed in the United States on 17 April 2019

prod_name: Arena Strength Booty Fabric Bands
title: Outstanding quality of product and support materials
review: I wanted a routine and "equipment" to follow while out of town to keep up resistance training.  After a lot of research, landed on Arena Strength products.  Am very impressed with the quality of both that Booty Bands and the Body Bands.  I also purchased the Body Cards - which are SO very organized in their presentation which included routines to follow and color code according to body parts.  Exceeded expectations!

prod_name: Yes4All Kettlebells with Protective Rubber Base
title: It Really Works!
review: I like to stay in shape by going to the gym, but on the days I can't get there, I work out at home. A person can do a full workout with nothing but a kettlebell. Even those who make use of every machine in the gym can benefit from workouts with kettlebells.I had a devastating accident, then a ruptured gallbladder, so you can imagine my workout schedule was set back some. Because of that setback, I had to begin working out almost like a beginner again. One of the first things I bought for our home gym was this kettlebell. It's only five pounds (I'm ashamed to admit that), but five pounds is what I need to start with right now. I'll work up from there.This kettlebell is very well made. It's so well made that I think it might last forever, yet it's very reasonably priced. It works. I do a lot of different exercises with this kettlebell. Some kettlebell exercises engage every muscle in the body, and I want to be able to do them, even if it's only with a five-pounder.If you're just beginning to work out or are elderly or can't use more than a five-pound kettlebell right now, I really recommend this one. It's even better than the ones at my gym. Just be careful no one's in the way when you swing it.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 16 December 2023

prod_name: Hawk Fitness Dip Belt with Chain
title: Great Belt
review: If you need some more weight for your pull ups or parallel bars exercises this one is for you.I have reached my limit in those exercises and needed something to bring some weight so I chose this product because it was cheap and got great reviews, I just want to clarify some things I have read during research:Sharpness- No, THIS PRODUCT HAVEN'T CUT ME AT ALL AND HAS NO SHARP EDGES, you just need to know how to connect it to your hip and stand up without it touching, I am no expert but I am sure you will find the way.Hip size compatibility- YES, NARROW HIPS CAN BE A CHALLENGE, however, once you put enough weight and start with the exercise, gravity will lock the belt to your hip without any problem.Durability and Usefulness- OVERALL THIS IS A GREAT BELT: even though it is cheap and could be more comfortable I have managed to use it for 70 lbs without any problem at all. I love this belt, don't listen to the bad reviews.i REALLY LIKE THE CASE came with it, it is super useful! I put my gloves in it and head straight to the gym

prod_name: Hawk Fitness Dip Belt with Chain
title: Good for moderate weight, if you know how to wear it.
review: This weight belt works well for weighted pullups, and for moderately heavy belt squats. If you're belt squatting more than about 300 pounds, go for a thicker belt and chain. The chain and caribiner are good enough below that. Stitching is good all around. There's two D-rings each with a carabiner, left and right. I wear the belt by attaching the chain to the left D-ring and carabiner at the 5th link (use more links if your waist is big). There's now a long and short end of chain hanging down on the left. Take the short end and attach it to the right D-ring and carabiner somewhere along the 5 links; like a belt buckle. Then take the long end and attach it to the right side D-link and carabiner. That loop now formed holds the weight, if you thread the chain through the weight first! Easy-peasy, and it doesn't fall off between sets.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 December 2021

prod_name: Hawk Fitness Dip Belt with Chain

title: Wouldn't trust it for maximal weight, but for weighted hangboarding, it works fine
review: What I like: The belt is very wide and padded, making it very comfortable and effective to use. The belt quality is good, and I could see this belt working well for high-resistance activities.What I don't like: This chain hooks that connect the chain to the belt are pretty cheap and don't fully close sometimes. I have to sort of make sure that the hook has fully closed before doing my work which is annoying. The chain itself is pretty light, and a bit flimsy and though I don't need to use this much weight, I don't think I'd trust this with more than about 90 pounds.Overall, for the money, for what I needed it for, this was a good buy. I'll never end up hanging more than about 25-30 pounds from the belt and for that reason, I'm happy with my purchase.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 19 March 2020

prod_name: Hawk Fitness Dip Belt with Chain
title: Funciona muy bien , no le he metido más de 15 kilos , veremos que tanto aguanta mientras progreso
review: Cómodo

prod_name: Hawk Fitness Dip Belt with Chain
title: Good product, but it can be better
review: I liked this belt, but the chain broke with 60 kilos (115 pounds). Would not recommend the chain itself, but for the price it is what you paid for.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 May 2023

prod_name: Hawk Fitness Dip Belt with Chain
title: For the price, it's awesome
review: For what you pay, it's fantastic. But whether or not it's "5 stars" depends on how you review...is it the highest quality? No. Is it the highest price? Also no.  The first belt that I received had some fraying on it. I emailed the owner, my email got lost, but he eventually got back to me and replaced it at no charge. Didn't even ask me to send the first one back. The chain itself seems a bit weak and light, but I have confidence that I could hang 90lbs from my waist and have no issues. So it will feel lighter than the chains you're maybe used to (definitely the case for me), but that doesn't mean it can't do the job.Overall, yes, I would recommend it.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 25 February 2020

prod_name: Hawk Fitness Dip Belt with Chain
title: Really solid for the price
review: Using this product for weighted dips and pullups. It's pretty durable. I've used it with up to a 45# plate and have had no issues
date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 August 2022

prod_name: Hawk Fitness Dip Belt with Chain
title: Get what you pay for
review: For around $20 don’t expect much.  The chain feels weak but should hold up. The metal clips are insanely sharp too….so don’t pitch your clothes or finger.  Gets the job done but I wouldn’t hang more than 60lbs from your waist.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 January 2023

prod_name: Hawk Fitness Dip Belt with Chain
title: Hawk Fitness belt replaced.
review: Update: Recieved replacement on defected belt I recieved prior to this one. If you see a problem with your belt, reach out to the seller and they are more than willing to send a replacement, as they want their customers to be satisfied with their product. The seller was kind and thoughtful enough to reach out to me first and made everything straight forward and simple. Everything was well packaged, seems to be well built and intact. Well cushioned belt for comfort and chain seems to be strong and sturdy, although I haven't tested it out just yet. If any problem occurs, I will update. If you don't see an update, that should mean belt is keeping up with weight being added. Cheers.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 26 January 2020

Works great. The only complaint I have is the chain can sometimes dig into my hips. It would be nice if there were a little more padding behind the chain where it connects to the belt.

prod_name: Hawk Fitness Dip Belt with Chain
title: Good for the price
review: This was exactly what I was looking for, an inexpensive belt with chain to use for weighted dips, pull-ups, etc. However, you get what you pay for. This is very inexpensive but not near as good as what you may have used at the gym. The chain is smaller and the carabiners are likewise small and not easy to clip on/off. It may not be able to handle really heavy weight plates but it does fine with light-to-moderate. It distributes weight pretty well.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 June 2020

prod_name: Hawk Fitness Dip Belt with Chain
title: Exactly what I needed
review: Started to grow out of body weight dips/pull-ups and shopped around for some belts. Came across this one and found that it’s a little more affordable than others so I gave it a chance, and boy is it a good belt. Does exactly what I need it to do, quality and durability is there. I’ve had up to 60lbs on it and it’s held up just fine. Read some reviews about sharp edges on some of the chain links and sure, there are a couple sharp-ish edges, but just be aware and careful when handling and you’ll be fine. Great product for a great price. Will update my review if anything changes.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 December 2019

prod_name: Hawk Fitness Dip Belt with Chain
title: Holds 200 pounds for weighted dips comfortably!
review: This belt holds comfortably 200 pounds. With this heavy amount of weight the belt is very comfortable around the waist. I know Hawk claims it can withstand 300 pounds, but I personally do not know anyone who can do 300 pound weighted dips. If  you can please post a video or a picture. But for someone not going over 200 pounds this belt is perfect and comfortable and you cannot beat the price!
date: Reviewed in the United States on 25 May 2021

prod_name: Hawk Fitness Dip Belt with Chain
title: Works well, minor flaw in design
review: First of all: it does the job.  It's sturdy and can hold at least 70 lbs (45+25 plates).  My only minor complaint is that the chains don't slip through the D-ring very well.  The chains get caught on the D-ring as you pull them through.  I think it's either a flaw in the angle of the D-ring or the shape of the chain link, but either way, it's just a tad bit annoying.  Not enough to really knock it but... potential future improvement maybe?
date: Reviewed in the United States on 13 September 2019

title: Bag ripped after only a little over a month of use.
review: The barbell pad, band, and straps work just fine. The reason I am giving the product two stars is because after only a little over a month of using it, the bag that holds everything ripped so bad that I can’t even use it anymore. It is very low quality and poorly made. The drawstring ripped first so I couldn’t close it, and then a few days later, the bag ripped on the bottom at the seam where the mesh and other fabric meet. I am not impressed and of course, it ripped right after the window for me to return the product so I can’t even get a replacement or my money back. I wouldn’t recommend this product unless you have another bag that you can put everything in. I only used the bag on leg day and only to carry the products that came with it. I was not rough with the bag. There should be no reason for it to break this easily.

prod_name: SPRI Braided Xertube Resistance Bands
title: Surprisingly good set of bands
review: I wanted to get in some upper body resistance work, but I'm no spring chicken and after years of overuse my shoulders are not what they used to be, so I thought resistance bands would be better than free weights.  I ordered the red resistance level, which turned out to be absolutely perfect for me.  I will say that if you order this you should ALSO order a door adapter that hangs at the hinge of a door, which makes the band much more versatile.  I've been using this about 3 days a week.  Takes up NO room, unlike heavy free weights it's not something you're going to be stubbing a toe on or accidentally dropping and damaging something.  Unlike MOST resistance bands, I have no worries about this separating from the handle, which is apparently a thing with cheaper tubing bands with only one point of connection at the handle.  This is solidly made, and I expect to continue enjoying it for many years.UPDATE: AFTER USING the red band for years, I came back for the next level up, the blue band. Both are used every other day, both are flawless. Have recommended to everyone I know searching for bands.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 26 May 2019
